page.title: 07SATURDAY CONTINUED
page.content:
Snell and Howard Quartly so we all walk down to the pub over the stile then down an old lane past the sewers and over a leaning gate and another. Next we walk up to the river which is down the bottom of the field. It takes
20 minutes to get there and another 10 minutes to tackle up and find a spot. It is only 10:30am.The river is a coarse fishing river. The main fish are Pike,Chub,Gudgeon and Roach.Gradually as the day goes on more people arrive at the river.The average size is 1lb. At 5:00pm we go home to mum who has got us some fish and chips which is a treat.After tea we muck about until 7:35pm.Then we go in and watch T.V. until about 11:00pm. Then I go to bed.
BY LOUIS QUARTLY
